author: Team Latestly
title: Exotic Patagonian Mara Seen Frolicking in Colorado Mountains, Rescue Operation On (See Pic and Video) | üëç LatestLY
text: Wildlife officials are on the lookout after an exotic Patagonian mara, a rabbit-like rodent native to South America, was spotted frolicking in the Colorado mountains. A user posted a video of the rare spotting on X, formerly Twitter. The sighting was first reported on Monday, and officials confirmed on Wednesday that the search for the elusive Patagonian mara is still ongoing. The adorable critter, standing two to three feet tall, has been seen by park rangers, hikers, and visitors in Bear Creek Lake Park, located just 15 miles outside of downtown Denver. Shark Attack in US: Shark Attacks Four People on South Padre Island During July 4 Celebrations, One Hospitalised (Watch Video). Exotic Animal Seen Frolicking in Colorado Mountains What is this thing? Seen near Morrison, Colorado USA pic.twitter.com/RfBvVJAMY6 ‚Äî Visual feast (@visualfeastwang) July 2, 2024 Operation to Rescue Exotic Patagonian Mara On Exotic Patagonian mara ‚Äî a tiny two to three-foot-tall critter ‚Äî seen by park rangers, hikers, visitors in Bear Creek Lake Park in Lakewood, CO, primarily found in grasslands and brushlands in central and southern Argentina - Rangers trying to catch it & find it a home - pic.twitter.com/13GsmHMLJ9 ‚Äî Blanche Victoria (@tammytabby) July 5, 2024
